commits.message:
Make euare-assumerole write all known auth variables

Roboto-based stuff like eucalyptus's admin tools completely ignores
environment variables like AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
and instead uses whatever credentials AWS_CREDENTIAL_FILE refers to.
The result is people assuming a role with euare-assumerole and then
accidentally using that file's credentials when they meant to use those
of the role.

We fix this problem by making euare-assumerole either write or unset
every auth-related environment variable we know of to prevent confusion.
At worst, this will cause the clients that this affects to complain
about missing credentials, but that is better than silently using
credentials other than those the user expects.

Fixes EUCA-10806
